column4: seems like the downloaded firefox doesnt connect to any sites (with and without linux32)... what could b wrong?
You have internet connection working, my guess is a setting in the /cofig? of that Firfox
yep. If i run x86_64 firefox from ubuntu repos with works fine
and don't think it is about firefox.cfg because i copied the file from the working version and it still doesn't work
I am newb to Debian/Linux, but that seems like a common program error of no comm or is a missing link in some config that permits Firefox to access.
Did you run the sys file checker?
yep. The weird thing is that it used to work fine... the feisty upgrade must have broken it
Revert, is an option at Boot, or use the backup that I hope you made...
ah, yep. I used it but has nothing to do
and i don't intend to use the backup. Feisty seems to have fixed more stuff than it broke =P
I have no idea what the command/sudo is for sys file check, but I saw it on the Debian Site, and a few Linux sites.
i don't think it is about it anyway... the command is fsck. I only checks for integrity and the system is fine. It's a matter of some firefox settings
just don't know where to look yet
I may have it bkmarked, am looking now
This is a start,,it isnt exact, but is a good source, http://www.tldp.org/LDP/Linux-Dictionary/html/Linux-Dictionary.html
ubuntu's firefox seems to detect wether the system is 64 or 32bits... any chance that firefox64 will use 32bits plugins if ran with linux32?
